snippet: The six people recounted being arrested on trespassing charges outside the homes of friends and loved ones — even outside their own apartments.
abstract: Charles E Bradley, who was arrested recently on trespassing charges in the Bronx, testifies in a federal hearing challenging New York City Police Department's stop-and-frisk policy; Bradley is one of six plaintiffs arguing that the police are using the department's Clean Halls program as a pretext to stop people as they leave private residential buildings, regardless of whether they are behaving suspiciously.
lead_paragraph: The six people recounted being arrested on trespassing charges outside the homes of friends and loved ones — even outside their own apartments.

headline.seo: Hearing on Trespassing Arrests Under Stop-and-Frisk Policy Continues
headline.main: First Plaintiffs Testify in Federal Challenge to Police Stop-and-Frisk Policy
headline.print_headline: Plaintiffs Start to Testify in Federal Challenge to Police Stop-and-Frisk Policy
